prompts:
Hi! I’m OPEBot. I will facilitate the student group collaboration during this activity. We’ll wait 1 minute for more teammates to join in, so please feel free to chat within this chat room.
Welcome to this Regex OPE activity! Let’s begin with introductions. Please tell the team your name and any interesting facts about yourself (such as your favorite hobby or game). We will spend 1 minute on these introductions.
Hi, [NAME]. Nice to meet you, [NAME]. Howdy, [NAME]. Hello, [NAME].
We're starting! I'm OPE_Bot.|||Use this window for chat and discussion.
*** IT IS VERY IMPORTANT THAT ONLY ONE PERSON AT A TIME -- THE DRIVER -- EDIT CELLS. *** If there is more than one editor, you could lose your work.
Now, before we begin Task 1, please spend 1 minute reading the Regex cheat sheet and the assignment introduction.
Starting now, you will have 80 minutes to complete this assignment and submit it for a grade. For each task, you will be assigned a group role, and roles will rotate after each task to give everyone a chance to contribute. Let’s assign roles for Task 1!
Beginning now, you will have approximately 80 minutes to complete the OPE tasks and submit to receive your grades.
Please share with the team (and me) which primer(s) you read for this session.
>
In preparation for the first task, who can share with the team when it is appropriate to apply denormalization within a database? This was discussed in the Normalization and Denormalization primer.
Okay! Let's assign your responsibilities and get started with Task 1.|||You will have approximately 80 minutes to complete programming and submit to receive your grades.
Please connect to MySQL by following the instructions in the workspace, then continue with the instructions for Task 1.
To submit your final query for Task 1, copy it to the Task 1 cell within double quotes, then run the Testing Task 1 cell.
You will be able to see feedback for each final query attempt in the output of the Testing Task 1 cell.
IT'S TIME TO MOVE ON FROM TASK 1. But first take turns responding to the following question.
IT'S TIME TO MOVE ON FROM TASK 1.
Discuss how your regex worked for part 1.
Follow up your Discussion.
In preparation for Task 2, who can share with the team the key considerations for creating effective composite indexes in a database? This was discussed in the Indexing primer.
IT'S TIME TO START TASK 2. Read and follow the instructions in the Task 2 cell.
To submit your final query for Task 2, copy it to the Task 2 cell within double quotes, then run the Testing Task 2 cell.
You will be able to see feedback for each final query attempt in the output of the Testing Task 2 cell.
IT'S TIME TO MOVE ON FROM TASK 2. But first take turns responding to the following question.
IT'S TIME TO MOVE ON FROM TASK 2.
Reflect on second regex.
Finish reflecting on second regex.
In preparation for the last task, who can share with the team when it is more suitable to use INT rather than CHAR in a database? This was discussed in the Data Types primer.
IT'S TIME TO START THE THIRD TASK. Read and follow the instructions in the Task 3 cell.
To submit your final query for Task 3, copy it to the Task 3 cell within double quotes, then run the Testing Task 3 cell.
You will be able to see feedback for each final query attempt in the output of the Testing Task 3 cell.
IT'S TIME TO MOVE ON FROM THE third TASK. But first take turns responding to the following question.
IT'S TIME TO MOVE ON FROM TASK 3.
ReFlect on ReGex
Finish and Follow regex 3
IT'S TIME TO START THE Fourth TASK. Read and follow the instructions in the Task 4 cell.
IT'S TIME TO MOVE ON FROM THE fourth and final TASK. But first take turns responding to the following question.
IT'S TIME TO MOVE ON FROM TASK 4.
ReFlect on 4th ReGex
Finish and Follow up your disccusion regex 4
Thanks for participating in today's OPE activity.|||Next, ONE TEAM MEMBER should execute the submit cell. After submission, your post-quiz token will be displayed below the cell. Copy this token and navigate to the "Post OPE Quiz" section of this module on Sail() to unlock and complete your post-quiz.
I'm logging off. Thanks for participating in today's OPE activity.|||Next, ONE TEAM MEMBER should execute the submit cell. After submission, your post-quiz token will be displayed below the cell. Copy this token and navigate to the "Post OPE Quiz" section of this module on Sail() to unlock and complete your post-quiz.
[NAME1], you will be the [ROLE1]. You are in charge of typing the code for Tasks 1 & 2. If more team members join later, first fill the Navigator role and then have any additional members be Researchers.|||Your team will rotate roles as you progress through the activity.
[NAME1], you will be the [ROLE1]. You are in charge of typing the code for Tasks 1 & 2. If more team members join later, first fill the Navigator role and then have any additional members be Researchers.|||Your team will rotate roles as you progress through the activity.
Your initial roles are - [ROLE1] - [NAME1] [ROLE2] - [NAME2] Recall that the Navigator brainstorms ideas and decides on which one the Driver will implement. If any team members join later, have them assume the Researcher role.|||Your team will rotate roles as you progress through the activity.
Your initial roles are - [ROLE1] - [NAME1] [ROLE2] - [NAME2] [ROLE3] - [NAME3] Recall that the Navigator brainstorms ideas and decides on which one the Driver will implement, and the Researcher refers to resources like the primer as necessary.
Your initial roles are - [ROLE1] - [NAME1] [ROLE2] - [NAME2] [ROLE3] - [NAME3] Recall that the Navigator brainstorms ideas and decides on which one the Driver will implement, and the Researcher refers to resources like the primer as necessary. Anyone who is unassigned will be a Researcher
[NAME1], you will be the Driver for this task since no one else joined in time. While you are by yourself, try to follow the responsibilities associated with all the roles -- i.e. try to first brainstorm for ideas, then analyze their pros and cons to choose one, and then implement it.|||If someone joins late, have them assume one of the missing roles and assist until you pass a test case.
[NAME1], you will be the Driver for this task since no one else joined in time. While you are by yourself, try to follow the responsibilities associated with all the roles -- i.e. try to first brainstorm for ideas, then analyze their pros and cons to choose one, and then implement it.|||If someone joins late, have them assume one of the missing roles and assist until you pass a test case.
Your new roles are - [ROLE1] - [NAME1] [ROLE2] - [NAME2] Recall that the navigator brainstorms ideas and decides on one which the driver then implements. If someone joins late, have them assume the researcher role and assist until you pass a test case.
Your new roles are - [ROLE1] - [NAME1] [ROLE2] - [NAME2] [ROLE3] - [NAME3] Recall that the researcher refers to resources like the primer as necessary.
Your new roles are - [ROLE1] - [NAME1] [ROLE2] - [NAME2] [ROLE3] - [NAME3] Whoever doesn't have an assignment is a researcher for this round. Recall that the researcher refers to resources like the primer as necessary.
[NAME1], you will be the Driver for this task since no one else joined in time. While you are by yourself, try to follow the responsibilities associated with all the roles -- i.e. try to first brainstorm for ideas, then analyze their pros and cons to choose one, and then implement it.|||If someone joins late, have them assume one of the missing roles and assist until you pass a test case.

While you are by yourself, try to follow the responsibilities associated with all the roles -- i.e. try to first brainstorm for ideas, then analyze their pros and cons to choose one, and then implement it.|||If someone joins late, have them assume one of the missing roles and assist until you pass a test case.
Your new roles are - [ROLE1] - [NAME1] [ROLE2] - [NAME2] If someone joins late, have them assume the researcher role and assist until you pass a test case.
Your new roles are - [ROLE1] - [NAME1] [ROLE2] - [NAME2] [ROLE3] - [NAME3]
Your new roles are - [ROLE1] - [NAME1] [ROLE2] - [NAME2] [ROLE3] - [NAME3] Whoever doesn't have an assignment is a researcher for this round.
